questions.question_text: If you create a control manually and later decide to create them automatically, what will be the result?

choices.A: ServiceNow will delete the manually created control
choices.C: ServiceNow creates a duplicate control without notifying the control owner
choices.B: ServiceNow creates a duplicate control and notifies the control owner
choices.D: ServiceNow identifies the control and does not create a duplicate

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Agreed and validated in the learning lab instance. 
Ensure a policy is not published. Create manual control for some of the planned entities and create controls automatically through Control Objectives. When you run the "GRC profile Generation" scheduled job, duplicate controls are created. No notifications are being generated to the entity or control owner.

comments.content: I did it, I've created a control (using "Inherit from control objective" check) in the control objective and after that i check the "Creates controls automatically" and i've assigned the Entity Type which contains the entity assigned before on the Control manually created. What was the Result? Servicenow doesn't create a duplicate.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Tested in my PDI

I believe its C, yet not 100% sure. 

It would skip creating a duplicate if the first one was also automatically created, but since its manually made I believe the system just creates another one and I do not believe a notification is sendt.

Selected Answer: A
Control objective do not have a lifecycle.

Selected Answer: A
Answer: A. Control Objective
Explanation: Control Objective[sn_compliance_policy_statement] doesn't seem to have a lifecycle attached, while Policy[sn_compliance_policy], Policy Exception[sn_compliance_policy_exception] and control[sn_compliance_control] all have a lilfecycle
Source: PDI, run <table_name>.do against those tables you can see the lifecycle on all but Control Objective[sn_compliance_policy_statement]
A is the correct answer
Control Objective does not have a Life cycle
A is correct : Control objective this follow policy life cycle, it has not Active & Inactive status
how is it that a policy does not have a lifecycle? this is incorrect
